comment.author: 64428854@N04
comment._content: I remember growing up hearing my grandmother complaining often that Ryan took undue credit for building the Spirit of St. Louis when it was actually her brother in law BF who owned the company and was credited by Lindbergh in all his books and correspondence. BF Mahoney had already purchased Ryan Aircraft and Ryan himself had little to do with the building of the Spirit of St Louis. BF had kept the name of the company as Ryan Aircraft leading to some confusion. see link: www.charleslindbergh.com/plane/mahoney.asp
